info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 03 at 7:08PM MST until August 03 at 8:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN MOHAVE COUNTY... At 708 PM MST, Doppler radar has indicated that heavy rain from earlier storms have moved west. Although the heavy rain has ended, it`s likely that significant runoff is occurring. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wild Cow Campground and Hualapai Peak. This includes the following streams and drainages... Griffith Wash, Cow Creek, Blue Tank Wash, Jackman Wash, Sacramento Wash, Deluge Wash, Wagon Wheel Wash, Rock Creek, Left Hand Moss Wash, Walnut Creek, Black Rock Wash, Yellow Flower Creek, Cane Springs Wash, Wheeler Wash, Bar I-L Wash, Knight Creek, Mackenzie Wash, Willow Creek, Hair Clipper Wash, Antelope Wash, Crow Canyon, Moss Wash, Pilgrim Wash, Timber Wash, Big Sandy River, Shingle Canyon and Cedar Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
